column5: Thanks everyone for the information. Planning to go with GEOBLUE! RBF.
I assume they don't cover you in Canada. I start medicare mid week of my trip next week.I will use travel ins. next time.
Check with your new Medicare insurer. My basic BCBS Medicare Advantage PPO covers emergency medical service world wide (with a $90 copay).

Planning to go to Lac Seul near Ear Falls, Ontario for a week end of August. Wanting to take out some medical travel insurance for the trip. Anyone have experience or recommendations with doing this? Any suggestions or information would be appreciated! RBF
We use GeoBlue Travel insurance. Haven't had to use it yet but it's peace of mind knowing you have some coverage in Canada. Relatively inexpensive especially if you have 5+ people in your group.
Star. Thank you! I will look into it! RBF
https://www.aardy.com/ This is who I use to find the best rates.
7 Mag Thank you. I will check it out. RBF

My customers (and myself for personal trips) have been using TravelEx Insurance for years. They pay out claims every year with few issues. I have also personally filed a claim when I had to cancel a cruise last minute and they paid it all.http://www.travelexinsurance.com/ind...HawkLake&go=bp This company is the one I put in every booking (hundreds a year). I would never book a trip anywhere without buying insurance. -FT

I start out using insuremytrip.com. It searches for a policy that meets your qualifications. I've always ended up using GeoBlue though. Under $100 for a 1 million policy with no lookback period for pre-existing conditions for a week in Canada. Have a great trip.
Fisherman Ted & FishingFever, Thanks for the recommendations. Much appreciated & I will be look into it. RBF
Don't know how old you are or what ins you currently have but my BCBS Medicare Advantage policy now covers travel to Canada.
Try GEOBLUE. Thats Blue Cross/ Blue Shield's temporary travel insurance policy Good Luck Fishing
